channel.title: Codes go into one line FIX
channel.description: Okay, idk if you know what i mean, but ever had the problem that happens like this: for example: [code] if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && playerRights >= 1){addSkillXP(486000000, 0);addSkillXP(486000000, 1);addSkillXP(486000000, 2);addSkillXP(486000000, 3);addSkillXP(486000000, 4);addSkillXP(486000000, 5);addSkillXP(486000000, 6);addSkillXP(486000000, 7);addSkillXP(486000000, 8);addSkillXP(486000000, 9);addSkillXP(486000000, 10);addSkillXP(486000000, 11); [/code] I know i know, bad example anyway, if you find a tut and the whole code is in one line, go to your desktop Right click>New>RICH TEXT DOCUMENT>and open it up, paste the code in there, then select it all and copy it again and then do w/e you want with the code and its fixed ;D hope i helped.

item.title: Codes go into one line FIX
item.dc:creator: @Evocation Evocation
item.description:
@Evocation wrote:

Ahaha i know that it was an example ;D
Dont lock my thread please oh buddy.

if (command.startsWith("Snippet, Locked.") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("jmood128")) sM("Don't lock my thread ffs"); Disconnected = true; }

Read full topic

item.title: Codes go into one line FIX
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Evocation, post:3, topic:378637”][quote author=n10si t link=topic=474502.msg3469559#msg3469559 date=1295196321]
Not a tutorial… Or a snippet… Idk what this is really…
[/quote]Same here… =[[/quote]

It has to be a snippet, it is less then 5 minutes, and it’s more of a comment scents kind of topic. Also you don’t really have to do all the things you said, you can just hit the Enter button… Also your code needs a closing bracket.

Read full topic

item.title: Codes go into one line FIX
item.dc:creator: @Evocation Evocation
item.description:
@Evocation wrote:

Okay, idk if you know what i mean, but ever had the problem that happens like this:
for example:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && playerRights >= 1){addSkillXP(486000000, 0);addSkillXP(486000000, 1);addSkillXP(486000000, 2);addSkillXP(486000000, 3);addSkillXP(486000000, 4);addSkillXP(486000000, 5);addSkillXP(486000000, 6);addSkillXP(486000000, 7);addSkillXP(486000000, 8);addSkillXP(486000000, 9);addSkillXP(486000000, 10);addSkillXP(486000000, 11);
I know i know, bad example
anyway, if you find a tut and the whole code is in one line, go to your desktop
Right click>New>RICH TEXT DOCUMENT>and open it up, paste the code in there, then select it all and copy it again and then do w/e you want with the code and its fixed ;D hope i helped.

Read full topic
